snippet: The United States should definitely respond to Syria’s murder of innocent civilians with poison gas. But a limited “shock and awe” missile attack isn’t the best strategy.
abstract: Thomas L Friedman Op-Ed column cautions against Pres Obama's strategy of seeking Congressional support for a one-time missile attack against Syrian military targets; calls instead for increasing training and arming of Free Syrian Army and using every diplomatic tool to shame Pres Bashar al-Assad.
lead_paragraph: The United States should definitely respond to Syria’s murder of innocent civilians with poison gas. But a limited “shock and awe” missile attack isn’t the best strategy.
